{"step_by_step_thinking": "Anti-D prophylaxis is administered to Rh(D)-negative women to prevent sensitization to the Rh(D) antigen. The purpose of anti-D prophylaxis is to prevent the production of anti-D antibodies in the mother's immune system, which can cause hemolytic disease of the newborn in subsequent pregnancies. In the given options, all of them involve potential events that can lead to fetal-maternal hemorrhage and sensitization to the Rh(D) antigen. Therefore, anti-D prophylaxis should be administered in all of these situations. Hence, the answer is None of the above.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
